description:

title: Software Engineer
description:
About Us

Clutch is a revolutionary vertical SaaS company, proudly backed by Andreessen Horowitz (A16z), aimed at revolutionizing the way Credit Unions engage and change the lives of their members. As a champion of financial well-being, we address the urgent need for affordable lending solutions in an era where the average American grapples with over $155,000 in household debt.¬† Unlike traditional financial institutions, Clutch develops software to turn Credit Unions into FinTech lenders and leverage their balance sheets to responsibly lend to over 130M Americans. Our mission extends beyond mere financial transactions; we strive to fundamentally enhance the way credit unions interact with their members. By integrating cutting-edge technologies and user-centric designs, we help credit unions provide seamless digital experiences that are on par with leading tech companies. This approach not only preserves but revitalizes the longstanding tradition of community and member-focused service inherent to credit unions.

About the Role

You will collaborate closely with the Product Manager and other engineers to develop a new product from the ground up. You'll contribute to discovery, technical design, and implementation, ensuring the product meets user needs and scales effectively.

You will be part of an agile team that thrives in ambiguity, focusing on iterating quickly and adapting to feedback as we shape the product roadmap together. Discovery skills, creativity, and a strong product mindset are essential.

This is a hands-on role where you'll make architectural decisions and implement scalable solutions.

About the Team

Our team values collaboration and ownership, working closely with cross-functional partners to deliver impactful results. We believe in fostering open communication and learning from each other to solve complex challenges.

We prioritize building products that make a difference for our users. Each team member is empowered to bring their ideas to the table, with a strong emphasis on continuous improvement and personal growth.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Work in collaboration with developers¬†and other stakeholders to enhance our platform, ensuring high-quality code and enabling the efficient delivery of features and improvements.

  • Write elegant, efficient, and testable code that is easy to maintain and debug

  • Take care of configurations and process documentation so stakeholders understand how to use the platform

  • As a true teammate, continuously improve the team‚Äôs processes, brainstorm ideas, communicate statuses, and progress

  • Mentor team members, provide feedback, and continuously improve as a professional

  • Learn the latest best practices, new concepts, and technologies and apply them accordingly to our context

What You‚Äôll Bring

  • 5+ years of experience in full-stack development, with expertise in a fast-paced environment, preferably in SaaS and/or Fintech.

  • Proven ability to work on early-stage products or startups, including experience in product discovery, rapid prototyping, and iterating based on user feedback.

  • Strong proficiency in modern frontend frameworks (e.g., React) and backend technologies (e.g., Node.js, Python).

  • Product mindset with a focus on understanding user needs and delivering impactful solutions.

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, testing best practices, and agile methodologies.

Please note that this role may evolve as our business needs change, so we appreciate your flexibility and adaptability.

What‚Äôs In It For You?

  • Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of remote work from anywhere, balancing life and career seamlessly.

  • Unforgettable Off-Sites: Twice a year, bond with colleagues in exciting destinations, fostering teamwork and fresh ideas.

  • Paid Time Off and National Holidays: Enjoy 20 PTO days yearly and the National Holidays for relaxation and rejuvenation.

  • Stock Options: Joining us means having a stake in our success, so you'll receive stock options as part of your compensation package.

  • Home Office Setup: Create your ideal workspace with a dedicated budget for home office essentials.

  • Work Trip Budget: Grow personally and professionally with a budget for work-related trips and co-working.

Please note: This position is offered on a contractor basis. Applicants must have the necessary documentation and authorization to work in the country where the job is located. Clutch cannot provide sponsorship or assist with obtaining work permits for this role.

üá¨üáßüá∫üá∏ Job description
As a Prompt Engineer at Didask, you'll join our R&D team to transform how organizations create and deliver effective training. Your mission: develop and optimize generative AI-powered solutions that make pedagogically sound learning experiences accessible to anyone, regardless of their teaching expertise.

This role combines technical expertise with educational impact:

  • Design and implement generative AI workflows for course generation and learner coaching, while maintaining high pedagogical standards

  • Partner with cognitive scientists and learning designers to ensure our AI solutions are grounded in learning science

  • Lead the evaluation and monitoring of our generative AI workflows' performance, from both technical and educational perspectives

  • Stay at the forefront of AI research and best practices, identifying opportunities to enhance our learning formats

  • Build and maintain our AI development framework, with a focus on documentation and replicability

Your profile

We're looking for someone who combines prompt engineering expertise with a passion for education. Here's what we expect:

  • Deep understanding of LLM capabilities and limitations, with proven experience in prompt engineering and LLM workflow design

  • Strong analytical mindset and systematic approach to problem-solving

  • Excellent communication skills, particularly in writing, as you'll work in a transparent, async-first environment

  • Genuine interest in education and learning science

  • Comfort with basic programming (our stack is JavaScript-based) and ability to collaborate with engineers

  • Professional proficiency in English and excellent writing skills in french are required,

The following would be a plus:

  • Background in education, cognitive science, or related fields

  • Experience in edtech or learning design

  • Track record of cross-functional collaboration in innovation settings

Why join our R&D team?

You'll be part of a unique mission: making effective learning accessible through the convergence of cognitive science and AI. This means:

  • Working on cutting-edge challenges where almost everything remains to be invented

  • Taking a thoughtful approach to AI ethics, considering both learner well-being and environmental impact

  • Contributing to a transparent, autonomous work culture in a multidisciplinary team

  • Taking part in a scale-up product: As Didask grows, we're expanding our resources and each employee's scope to accelerate innovation and continuous improvement cycles.

More about our R&D team mission

The problem we aim to solve is enabling anyone, regardless of teaching expertise, to quickly create educationally effective training on any subject.

After years developing learning formats, we're leveraging generative AI to:

  • Automatically generate interactive training from user content with minimal manual intervention (e.g., converting documentation into interactive online courses)

  • Power AI-driven learning interactions (e.g., providing automated formative feedback on exercises)

Our goal is to enhance the pedagogical effectiveness of existing formats while creating new ones to address currently unmet learning objectives.

title: Social Media Marketing Specialist (Content & Creatives)

Because controlling how you spend money is an excruciatingly boring task compared to figuring out how to earn more. description:
